revised_title: Antiferromagnetic Exchange in Triclinic Cobalt Benzoate Crystals
tldr: The authors studied the antiferromagnetic exchange in triclinic crystals of tetra-u-benzoato-bis(4-methylquinoline) dicobalt II. They measured the magnetic susceptibilities and interpreted the results within a quantum mechanical model. The study showed that the antiferromagnetic coupling between cobalt atoms is almost entirely determined by interactions between metal orbitals, likely through a superexchange process involving the delocalized bonding framework of the bridging carboxylate groups.
